intro: Nauclea schlechteri, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates. Nauclea schlechteri is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
